result.execSummary:
The defendant Pervis L Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid to First Bank Financial Institution as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Krete Industries or First Bank Financial Institution.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 from Preliminary Hearing held on 4/16/15 - destroyed pursuant to statute.

Defendant Pervis L Daniels in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1, 5 and 7. 

Court orders the following: (Waukesha County - 15CF379)
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) consecutive to Cts. 5 & 7  Stayed for 3 years Probation concurrent to Cts. 5 & 7
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $6751.50 to be paid to 1st Bank Financial Institution as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Krete Industries or 1st Bank Financial Institution.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Check Case on August 3, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Pervis L Daniels in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, 5 and 7.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2, 3, 4, 6, 8 and 9 dismissed and read - in. Court orders a Presentence Investigation to be compiled and filed within 45 days by 08/03/2015. Court will set sentencing in 60 days. State requests defendant be held without bail. Court orders bail revoked.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Pervis L Daniels in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a date in 2 weeks. There is related conduct in 2 other counties. Defense is requesting consolidation. Court grants request. Defense to advise the Court on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.

Defendant Pervis L Daniels in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Michael Skemp from the City of Brookfield P.D. was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 marked. Cross examination by the defense. Exhibit #1 is received.  State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Pervis L Daniels in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Benedict moves to modify bail.  State objects.  Court denies motion to modify.    Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
